newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar shares keep climbing in the week.
newsitem.headline: Qatar shares keep climbing in the week.

text.p: Shares at Qatar's unofficial stock market continued their gradual rise in the week to Thursday, boosted by renewed expectations that government will soon announce the setting up of a formal exchange, brokers said.
"An announcement regarding the setting up of an official market can be expected any time during the next two months," said a banker.
In July 1995 the Emir Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani decreed the setting up of the Doha Securities Market. The authorities are currently drafting regulations for the exchange.
In the week to Thursday, the 18-share Commercial Bank of Qatar (CBQ) index, which has been rising steadily for the past three months, closed at 115.22 points from 114.66 last week.
Ten shares rose, seven were steady and one fell in trade focused on financial stocks.
Market leader Qatar National Bank rose five riyals to 545 and Qatar Insurance climbed by the same amount to 630.
The CBQ and Qatar General Insurance added two riyals each to a respective 316 and 507. Doha Bank and Al Ahli Bank of Qatar were each one riyal higher at 263 and 202 respectively.
Al Khaleej Insurance moved up a riyal to 281 and Qatar Navigation and Qatar Flour Mills each gained two riyals to 680 and 282. Qatar Cement also advanced a riyal to 280.
The only loser in the week, Qatar Tourism and Leisure Co, was two riyals lower at 43.
